metadata.dc:author: Abellán Martínez, M C
Ruiz López, F J
Méndez Martínez, P
Martínez Garcerán, J J
Sánchez Gascón, F
Hernández Martínez, J
metadata.dc:description: Foreign body aspiration requires emergency bronchoscopic examination when the product is chemically active. We describe the case of a female patient who aspirated a ferrous sulfate tablet that, in spite of being extracted immediately, caused lesions that persisted in the bronchial tree for 6 weeks. We then discuss the potential of ferrous sulfate substance to cause damage to the tracheobronchial tree.
metadata.dc:title: Lesiones en el árbol traqueobronquial tras aspiración de una tableta de sulfato ferroso.
[Lesions of the tracheobronchial tree after the aspiration of a tablet of ferrous sulfate].
